page.title: 14ENVIRONMENTAL STUDY CENTRE
page.content: Mrs Hopkins runs the environmental centre.Her salary is paid by Bucks County Council because she is a teacher but the electricity board pay for everything else.She once had two classrooms,but in 1981 one classroom burnt down overnight due to an electrical fault,with all her microscopes,specimens etc.Every day school children from Bucks, and, sometimes adults,visit _ about 5000 people a year!Flora and fauna are very varied as there are two different soil types.On the top it is clay,and in the dip it is almost down to chalk bedrock.In 1972 two species of grass and clover were sown,and this year Mrs Hopkins has counted 128 different species,and 190 orchids.There is a nature trail with 13 view-points,and we were each given a book about it.
